title: Man dies after being run over by his own car on his driveway and getting trapped
text:

A man has died after being run over by his own car in his driveway in Wales.

Arwyn Ward, 66, died four days after he became trapped beneath his car in the driveway of his home in the village of Glanamman.

Neighbours heard Mr Ward call for help and contacted emergency services who rushed to the property last Monday morning.

Firefighters were able to release him from underneath the car with the use of specialist equipment, reports Wales Online .

(Image: Wales Onlibe WS)

He was given first aid outside the property before being taken to hospital by the Welsh Ambulance Service.

However, police have now confirmed that he has died.

The exact circumstances of the incident are unclear.

However one resident who lives in the same road said following the incident “one of the neighbours turned the engine off and put the hand brake on”, while another said:

“The car was in the reverse position going down the drive - how on earth it happened we don’t know.”

A spokeswoman for Dyfed-Powys Police said: “Officers were called to Maes Llewelyn in Glanamman at around 8.45am on Monday, October 7, to a report of a collision involving a single vehicle. A man was found to be trapped under the car, and was taken to hospital with life-threatening injuries.

"Sadly. the man passed away on October 11."

The coroner for Carmarthenshire has confirmed that an inquest into Mr Ward's death has been opened and adjourned to a later date.

Dyfed-Powys Police say his next of kin have been informed.
description: Arwyn Ward, 66, died four days after he became trapped beneath the car in the Welsh village of Glanamman
